nodes.text: The Industrial mineral scanner was a model of scanner made by Crozo Industrial Products and available in the period following the Battle of Yavin during the Galactic Civil War between the Galactic Empire and the Alliance to Restore the Republic. The device was cost 500. The mineral scanner was able to send out a 100 meter pulse in all directions that would survey the area for nearby Minerals. Lower concentrations of minerals would show up faded on the data screen where as higher concentrations would show up more solid.
The Industrial mineral scanner was first mentioned in the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook released by Fantasy Flight Games in 2013 and written by Sterling Hershey.
